alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 6:19PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Martin, east central Floyd and Pike Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 619 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Conder to near Meta to Phelps. Movement was southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Meta and Kimper around 625 PM EDT. Varney around 630 PM EDT. Piso, Jarad and Heenan around 635 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Raccoon, Zebulon, Biggs, Fedscreek, Gulnare, Chloe, Mouthcard, Garden Village, Phyllis, Toonerville, Shelbiana, Pikeville, Coal Run Village, Elkhorn City, Boldman, Coal Run, Belcher, Fishtrap Lake, Cedarville, Galveston and Marrowbone. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 1 and 18. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County near mile marker 1. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 7 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
